title: Collaborative Text Editing for Shiny with Automerge
text: Shiny module syncs across browser sessions using Shiny’s reactive system. external server required - Shiny process manages document state directly. Open multiple browser windows real-time collaboration.
code: library(shiny) library(autoedit)  ui <- fluidPage(   textarea_ui("editor", label = "Collaborative notes") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   text <- textarea_server("editor", initial_text = "Start typing...")   observe(print(text())) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Collaborative Text Editing for Shiny with Automerge
text: CodeMirror 6 code editor widget syncs via WebSocket automerge-repo compatible server. Suitable collaboration across different applications persistent documents.
code: library(autoedit)  # Connect to a sync server editor("ws://localhost:3030", "document-id")  # Or use the public Automerge sync server editor("wss://sync.automerge.org", "your-document-id")

title: Collaborative Text Editing for Shiny with Automerge
code: library(shiny) library(automerge) library(autosync) library(autoedit)  server <- amsync_server(port = 3030, host = "127.0.0.1") server$start()  doc_id <- create_document(server) doc <- get_document(server, doc_id) am_put(doc, AM_ROOT, "text", am_text("")) am_commit(doc, "init")  ui <- fluidPage(editor_output("editor"))  shiny_server <- function(input, output, session) {   output$editor <- editor_render(editor(server$url, doc_id)) }  onStop(function() server$stop()) shinyApp(ui, shiny_server)

title: Collaborative textarea server — textarea_server
text: id Module ID (must match ID used textarea_ui()). doc_id Document identifier. textareas doc_id synchronize together. Default "default". initial_text Initial text content. used creating new document; ignored document already exists. debounce_ms Debounce delay milliseconds text input changes. Default 150ms.

title: Collaborative textarea server — textarea_server
text: reactive expression returning current synchronized text.

title: Collaborative textarea server — textarea_server
text: module uses Shiny's reactive system synchronize text across multiple browser sessions without requiring external sync server. session maintains local Automerge document syncs shared master document using Automerge's sync protocol. Concurrent edits automatically merged using Automerge's CRDT algorithm, ensuring eventual consistency across sessions.
